members.title: LA turns Confederate statues that launched US protests into art
key_points: Confederate monuments, such as those of Robert E. Lee and Thomas 'Stonewall' Jackson, are widely seen as symbols of white supremacy and the ideology of the 'Lost Cause' that downplays the role of slavery in the Civil War.

The removal and melting of the Robert E. Lee statue in Charlottesville in 2021 and its display as melted bronze in Los Angeles represents a transformation from political symbols to art as a tool for cultural critique.
The exhibition 'Monuments' in Los Angeles recontextualizes Confederate statues through contemporary art, challenging the narrative that the Civil War was about states' rights rather than slavery.

canonical_title: 'No Kings' protests: where does Democratic opposition go next?

members.title: 'No Kings' protests: where does Democratic opposition go next?
key_points: The 'No Kings' protests in October 2025 demonstrate widespread public opposition to President Donald Trump’s use of presidential authority and policies, especially on immigration, tariffs, and government spending.
Democratic opposition is growing despite lacking control of Congress, with public support at a historic low, indicating a need for strategic realignment and electoral mobilization.

The ongoing government shutdown has intensified political tensions and created financial hardship for federal workers, fueling public discontent and pushing Democrats to take a more confrontational stance.

canonical_title: Diwali: India sparkles as millions celebrate the festival of lights
entities: Social media platforms (Instagram, YouTube, X, Facebook)

members.title: Diwali: India sparkles as millions celebrate the festival of lights
key_points: Diwali, a major Hindu festival, is celebrated by millions across India, involving cultural rituals, family gatherings, and traditional food sharing.
Traditional firecrackers contribute significantly to air pollution, especially in northern India during winter, prompting environmental concerns.
The Supreme Court of India has permitted the sale and use of 'green crackers' in Delhi, ending a 2020 ban, with claims of reducing pollution by 20–30%.

canonical_title: Trump ends aid to Colombia, calls country's leader a 'drug leader'

members.title: Trump ends aid to Colombia, calls country's leader a 'drug leader'
key_points: US President Donald Trump has announced the end of all subsidies and aid to Colombia, citing President Gustavo Petro as a 'drug leader' and accusing him of enabling widespread drug production.

The decision follows a September military strike by US forces on a Colombian fishing boat, which allegedly killed fisherman Alejandro Carranza and violated Colombian sovereignty, prompting Petro’s accusations of murder.
The US government claims the strikes target drug trafficking, particularly fentanyl, and cites intelligence confirming a submarine attack carried out in October 2025 was laden with narcotics.

canonical_title: The two words you need to help you push back at work

members.title: The two words you need to help you push back at work
key_points: Saying 'no' is essential to prevent burnout and maintain work-life balance.
The phrase 'I don't' is more effective than 'I can't' when setting boundaries at work.
Burnout is not just a workplace issue for high earners — it affects anyone, especially those with family responsibilities.

canonical_title: Bangladesh airport inferno estimated to cost $1bn in damages
entities: Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA)
International Air Express Association of Bangladesh

members.title: Bangladesh airport inferno estimated to cost $1bn in damages
key_points: A devastating fire broke out at the logistics section of the main airport in Bangladesh on Saturday, with damages estimated at over $1 billion.
The fire destroyed clothes, raw materials, and essential samples used for securing new buyers, potentially affecting the global garment supply chain.
Bangladesh is the world's second-largest exporter of clothing after China, supplying major retailers like H&M and Walmart, making the incident highly relevant to global fashion markets.

canonical_title: How China's Five Year Plans have changed the world
entities: Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party

members.title: How China's Five Year Plans have changed the world
key_points: China's Five Year Plans are strategic, long-term blueprints that shape national development and have far-reaching global consequences.
The 1978 'reform and opening up' under Deng Xiaoping transformed China's economy and triggered a global shift in manufacturing, leading to 'the China shock' and economic realignments in the West.

China's move toward 'strategic emerging industries' like electric vehicles and solar energy in the 2010s made it the global leader in green technology and a dominant force in renewable energy supply chains.

canonical_title: Indonesia food poisonings and protests test Probowo's first year in office

members.title: Indonesia food poisonings and protests test Probowo's first year in office
key_points: Prabowo Subianto's promise of dynamic economic growth and social change has been undermined by real-world challenges, including food poisoning from a free school meals programme and public protests over cost of living.
Over 9,000 children have fallen ill since the free school meals programme began in January, with images of dehydrated, weak children showing serious flaws in food safety and programme implementation.

The programme, costing $28 billion annually, is accused of being ineffective and financially unsustainable due to poor logistics, lack of refrigeration, and weak food safety oversight across 6,000 islands.

canonical_title: Cate Blanchett: In praise of the humble seed
entities: The Prince of Wales (now King Charles III)

members.title: Cate Blanchett: In praise of the humble seed
key_points: The Millennium Seed Bank at Wakehurst holds over 2.5 billion seeds from 40,000 wild plant species, serving as a global repository for biodiversity.
The seed bank plays a crucial role in restoring degraded ecosystems such as chalk grasslands in the South Downs and tropical forests worldwide.
Cate Blanchett, a globally recognized film actress, has become an ambassador for the project, drawing public attention to its significance and accessibility.

canonical_title: China's economic growth slows as trade tensions with US flare up

members.title: China's economic growth slows as trade tensions with US flare up
key_points: China's economic growth slowed to 4.8% in Q3 2025, the weakest pace in a year, due to persistent property market issues and escalating trade tensions with the US.
China imposed sweeping export controls on rare earth minerals, a move that triggered a sharp reaction from the US, including threats of 100% additional tariffs.
The US responded with threats of punitive tariffs, prompting diplomatic efforts such as a planned meeting between US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Chinese officials in Malaysia.

canonical_title: Questions surround singer D4vd weeks after teen’s body found in his Tesla

members.title: Questions surround singer D4vd weeks after teen’s body found in his Tesla
key_points: The body of 15-year-old Celeste Rivas Hernandez was found in the front trunk of singer D4vd's Tesla on September 8, 2024, raising serious questions about her death and her connection to the artist.
Celeste had a history of running away from home, with multiple reported disappearances between April 2024 and September 2024, suggesting possible instability or emotional distress.
A matching tattoo — 'Shhh...' — was found on both Celeste’s index finger and D4vd’s index finger, fueling speculation about a personal relationship.
